page.title: 15RELIGION(cont)
page.content: The difference in attitudes of Alstone and Teddington populaces, are reflected in the attendances at each church.In the former and smaller village, a larger percentage worship to a more traditional pattern,in which the village still revolves around the hub of an active church. Parishioners who wish to worship with the non-conformist churches have to travel about five miles to the Tewkesbury and Winchcombe areas,where non-conformity is vigorous. Sunday in the area still holds vestiges of an idyllic English rural scene,although 20th.century changes are impinging on the scene making Sunday much like any other day.
